Row.Text: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Happiness[ENDCOLOR] is the measurement of a city's appeal and is used to offset Unhappiness. When a city has more Happiness than Unhappiness, that Happiness contributes to positive Production.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Unhappiness[ENDCOLOR] is the opposite to Happiness. When a city has more Unhappiness than Happiness, that Unhappiness contributes to negative Production. If the city is Unhappy for too long, it may enter a period of Resistance. Unhappiness is primarily increased by the city's Population.

A city's [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Happiness[ENDCOLOR] is increased through the construction of buildings such as the Circus. It is also increased by your Global Happiness, which is applied locally based upon the number of cities in your empire.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Resistance[ENDCOLOR] is a state in which the city cannot produce any yields. A period of Resistance will occur if a city is more Unhappy than it is Happy for too long. This is the same state incurred after conquering a city.
